statements: SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE department_id = 1;
SELECT employee_id, performance_rating FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE productivity_score > 80;
SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE date_recorded BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-06-30';
SELECT department_id, AVG(performance_rating) AS avg_rating FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics GROUP BY department_id;
SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics ORDER BY productivity_score DESC, performance_rating ASC;
SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics ORDER BY employee_id ASC, date_recorded DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT employee_id, department_id, performance_rating FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE productivity_score > 80 ORDER BY department_id DESC
SELECT AVG(performance_rating) AS avg_rating, MAX(productivity_score) AS max_score FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics GROUP BY department_id HAVING AVG(performance_rating) > 4
SELECT * FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics WHERE date_recorded BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31' ORDER BY productivity_score DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT department_id, COUNT(employee_id) AS employee_count FROM EmployeePerformanceMetrics GROUP BY department_id HAVING employee_count > 10 ORDER BY employee_count DESC
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, department, role FROM employees WHERE department = 'Engineering';
SELECT id, salary FROM employees WHERE role = 'Manager' ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT * FROM performance_metrics WHERE productivity_score > 80;
SELECT employee_id, feedback FROM performance_metrics WHERE LENGTH(feedback) > 50 ORDER BY employee_id ASC;
SELECT id, name, department, role, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000 ORDER BY department DESC, name;
SELECT id, name, department, role, salary FROM employees WHERE department='IT' OR role='Manager' ORDER BY salary DESC;
SELECT e.id, e.name, e.department, e.role, e.salary, pm.productivity_score, pm.feedback FROM employees e JOIN performance_metrics pm ON e.id = pm.employee_id WHERE e.salary <= 70000;
SELECT e.name, e.department, e.role, pm.productivity_score FROM employees e LEFT JOIN performance_metrics pm ON e.id = pm.employee_id WHERE pm.productivity_score > 80;
SELECT e.id, e.name, e.department, e.role, e.salary, pm.feedback FROM employees e RIGHT JOIN performance_metrics pm ON e.id = pm.employee_id WHERE pm.feedback IS NOT NULL ORDER BY e.name ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, department_id FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT department_name FROM departments WHERE department_id = 2;
SELECT employee_name, metric_name, metric_value FROM employees INNER JOIN performance_metrics ON employees.employee_id = performance_metrics.employee_id;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_employees FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, department_name FROM employees JOIN departments ON employees.department_id = departments.department_id
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department_id IN (SELECT department_id FROM departments WHERE department_name = 'IT')
SELECT AVG(metric_value) AS average_metric_value FROM performance_metrics GROUP BY employee_id
SELECT employee_name, hire_date FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT employee_name, metric_name, metric_value FROM employees INNER JOIN performance_metrics ON employees.employee_id = performance_metrics.employee_id ORDER BY metric_value DESC
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department='HR';
SELECT name, position FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT department_name, location FROM departments WHERE manager_id IS NULL;
SELECT employee_id, metric_name, metric_date FROM performance_metrics JOIN employees ON performance_metrics.employee_id = employees.id WHERE metric_value > 80;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC, salary ASC, name
SELECT name, department, hire_date FROM employees WHERE department='IT' AND salary > 50000
SELECT e.name, pm.metric_name, pm.metric_value FROM employees e JOIN performance_metrics pm ON e.id = pm.employee_id WHERE pm.metric_value > 90
SELECT d.department_name, d.location, e.name FROM departments d JOIN employees e ON d.manager_id = e.id

SELECT d.department_name, pl.productivity_score, pl.assessment_date FROM departments d JOIN productivity_levels pl ON d.department_id = pl.department_id WHERE pl.assessment_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31'
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT name, position FROM employees WHERE department='Engineering';
SELECT employee_id, name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE hire_date > '2022-01-01';
SELECT project_name, start_date, end_date FROM projects ORDER BY start_date DESC;
SELECT task_name, status FROM tasks WHERE status='In Progress' ORDER BY task_name ASC;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department='HR' ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT e.name, e.department, d.department_name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department=d.department_name WHERE e.position='Manager';

SELECT p.project_name, d.department_name, t.task_name, t.status FROM projects p JOIN departments d ON p.department_id=d.department_id JOIN tasks t ON p.project_id=t.project_id WHERE t.status='In Progress';
SELECT e.name, pm.metric_name, pm.metric_value FROM employees e JOIN performance_metrics pm ON e.employee_id=pm.employee_id WHERE pm.metric_value > 90;
SELECT e.name, e.department, p.project_name, t.task_name, t.deadline FROM employees e JOIN tasks t ON e.employee_id=t.employee_id JOIN projects p ON t.project_id=p.project_id ORDER BY t.deadline ASC;
